physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Intermittently very anxious and hyperventilating. Gagging sensation observed when attempting to drink water, with improvement after expectorating the liquid. Able to swallow solids. Normal findings in the remainder of the examination.

Ptosis of the right eyelid, mild facial twitching, postural hand tremors, and dysmetria on finger–nose–finger and heel-to-shin testing. Hyperactive deep-tendon reflexes. Rushed and fluent speech with occasional slurred words.
Tremulous, agitated, confused; showing significant respiratory distress with low oxygen saturation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Deterioration in vital signs and respiratory status observed after lumbar puncture.
